You installed grub to your Windows partition boot sector. You almost never want to install grub to a partition.
I just wanna keep my files safe.
No, don't follow that unless you can't run chkdsk from within Windows.
OK let me try booting from my CD again :)
Follow this guide to restore your Windows partition boot record: http://sourceforge.net/apps/mediawiki/bootinfoscript/index.php?title=Boot_Problems:Boot_Sector
And remember, *never* install grub's boot sector to a partition (like /dev/sda1). Always install grub to the mbr (like /dev/sda).
erm u cannot select where to install gurb isnt it?
At some point someone installed grub to your Windows partition boot sector. By default grub is installed to the MBR so that must have been done / selected manually.
I'm pretty sure that the menu sskniranjan is talking about is from ntldr / BCD (wubi) rather than grub.

Vortex: Wubi is a way of installing Ubuntu within a file in your windows partition and without replacing Windows' bootloader.
Vortex: So it's not grub that he is seeing (at first at least), it's the Windows bootloader which then loads grub.
